p: In the first 3 months immediately following transplantation, bacterial infections predominate. They usually have a nosocomial source such as indwelling catheters and drains. Prolonged intubation increases risk of infections. Abdominal abscesses, cholangitis, wound infections, and nosocomial pneumonias are common. Clostridium difficile colitis may also occur [ 196, 197] (Fig. 15.2).
